subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1243432054
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

copper is a great conductor
 
 
In a message dated 5/27/2009 9:44:02 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
w9sz.zack@... writes:

 
 


Aluminum wire is a nightmare! The stuff tends to overheat, oxidizes  where 
interconnections are made and will spark, etc. 
 
I bought a transformer at Gateway Electronics in St. Louis some  years ago 
that looked like a great transformer for a high-current 12 volt  supply. The 
secondary appeared to be wound with #8 enameled wire. I found out  the 
secondary was wound with aluminum wire. After I built the power  supply and 
tried to get 20 amps from it but couldn't, I gave up on it and got  another 
transformer wound with copper wire.

Zack


On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:16 AM, Frank Sumption 
<_purplealiengirl@purpleali_ (mailto:purplealiengirl@...) >  wrote:


 
 


We have a touch lamp that comes on by itself, and we have  electric matress 
heaters that make a clicking noise in the radio when the  controller is on. 
When the furnace comes on, it affects the boxes,  and--when I first started 
doign EVP recordings with white noise, if  the furnace happened to come on 
when I was recording a voice would  report "it's on fire!".
 
 What if that house has aluminum wire?
 
 Frank-S



On Tue, May 26, 2009 at 5:15 PM, April Abercrombie  
<_april@abercrombieghapril@abercrapr_ (mailto:april@...) >  wrote:


 
 


Thanks! Would that account for the  tapping noise?
 

 
----- Original Message ----- 
From: _Rj_ (mailto:rasterer@...)  
To: _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  

 
Sent: Tuesday, May 26, 2009 4:07  PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Electrical  Question




 
Yes.  Also faulty wiring, which is even more  dangerous.
Also with flakey transformers or other power  distribution in the area, or 
power lines.
Perhaps you can check  with some neighbors, and see how their power is  
doing.


--- On Tue, 5/26/09, April Abercrombie  
<_april@abercrombieghapril@abercrapr_ (mailto:april@...) >  wrote:


From: April  Abercrombie <_april@abercrombieghapril@abercrapr_ 
(mailto:april@...) >
Subject:  [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question
To: "EVP-ITC Group" <_EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ 
(mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) >
Date:  Tuesday, May 26, 2009, 2:52 PM


 
Hi All,
 
Is there someone here that  can answer and electrical question for me?
 
During the case that I  recorded those possible EVP's-there was a loud 
tapping noise  that seemed to come from the 2nd bedroom. Upon checking my logs,  
every time one of  these clicks were heard, there would be  an EMF spike in 
the livingroom. The 2nd bedroom is upstairs, the  livingroom downstairs. 
The home owners have also reported that  they have a touch lamp that comes on 
all the time by itself and  the lights in the Kitchen will dim occasionally.
 
Now these taps are not  consistent in timing, loudness or rhythm. Could 
this be the work  of faulty breakers?
 
Thanks!
April
